document_title: Mitral valve stenosis: Causes, signs, complications and prevention
subsection_content:
Although mitral valve stenosis is less common in recent years because fever caused by streptococcus tends to decrease, however in developing countries this disease still exists.
In addition to people with a history of rheumatic fever or autoimmune diseases, the elderly, smokers, people with high blood pressure, diabetes, lipid disorders... are also at high risk of getting the disease.
